sen.j: 井上 八千代（いのうえ やちよ）は、井上流家元の名跡。
sen.e: Yachiyo INOUE is the name given to the head of the INOUE School.
Yachiyo INOUE is the name given to the head of the INOUE School.
Yachiyo INOUE is the name given to the head of the INOUE School.

sen.j: 本名・井上サト（1767年 − 1854年）
sen.e: Given Name: Sato INOUE (1767-1854)
Given Name: Sato INOUE (1767-1854)
Given Name: Sato INOUE (1767-1854)

sen.j: 宮廷文化を基盤に創始。
sen.e: Founded the school based on court culture.
Founded the school based on court culture.
Founded the school based on court culture.

sen.j: 本名・井上アヤ（1770年 - 1868年）
sen.e: Given Name: Aya INOUE (1770-1868)
Given Name: Aya INOUE (1770-1868)
Given Name: Aya INOUE (1770-1868)

sen.j: 初世の兄の娘。
sen.e: The daughter of the brother of Yachiyo INOUE the 1st
The daughter of the brother of Yachiyo INOUE the 1st
The daughter of the brother of Yachiyo INOUE the 1st

sen.j: 能の型を取り入れる。
sen.e: Incorporated elements from Noh.
Incorporated elements from Noh.
Incorporated elements from Noh.

sen.j: 本名・片山春子（1838年- 1938年9月7日 旧姓 吉住）。
sen.e: Given Name: Haruko KATAYAMA (1838-September 7, 1938; maiden name: YOSHIZUMI)
Given Name: Haruko KATAYAMA (1838-September 7, 1938; maiden name: YOSHIZUMI)
Given Name: Haruko KATAYAMA (1838-September 7, 1938; maiden name: YOSHIZUMI)

sen.j: 初代家元・サト、二代家元・アヤに師事する。
sen.e: Studied under the 1st head of the school, Sato, and the 2nd, Aya.
Studied under the 1st head of the school, Sato, and the 2nd, Aya.
Studied under the 1st head of the school, Sato, and the 2nd, Aya.

sen.j: 夫は能楽能職掌観世流七世片山九郎右衛門。
sen.e: Her husband was Kanze School Noh actor Kurouemon KATAYAMA the 7th.
Her husband was Kanze School Noh actor Kurouemon KATAYAMA the 7th.
Her husband was Kanze School Noh actor Kurouemon KATAYAMA the 7th.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）の都をどり創設にあたっては振付ならびに指導を担当、これまで座敷舞であった京舞を舞台にのせ、また祇園町と井上流の関係を深めて流派を興隆にみちびいた。
sen.e: Did choreography and instruction for the Miyako Odori at its founding in 1872 (Meiji year 5), taking Kyoumai dancing out of the traditional private venues and onto the stage; she also strengthened ties between Gion and the Inoue school, leading the school on an ascent.

Did choreography and instruction for the Miyako Odori at its founding in 1872 (Meiji year 5), taking Kyoumai dancing out of the traditional private venues and onto the stage; she also strengthened ties between Gion and the Inoue school, leading the school on an ascent.

Did choreography and instruction for the Miyako Odori at its founding in 1872, taking Kyoumai dancing out of the traditional private venues and onto the stage; she also strengthened ties between Gion and the Inoue school, leading the school on an ascent.

sen.j: 四世井上八千代、松本佐多はじめ多くの弟子をそだてている。
sen.e: She had many students, including the 4th Yachiyo INOUE and Sata MATSUMOTO.
She had many students, including Yachiyo INOUE the 4th and Sata MATSUMOTO.
sen.cmt: 他と統一する為、the 4thを語尾に変更。
sen.e: She had many students, including Yachiyo INOUE the 4th and Sata MATSUMOTO.

sen.j: なお家元名 井上八千代を名乗るのは96歳の時で、それまでは片山春子で通していた片山家能楽・京舞保存財団のウェブサイト中の記述を参照し加筆。
sen.e: She received the name of Yachiyo INOUE at 96 years of age; before which she went by Haruko Katayama; refer to the website of the Katayama Family Noh and Kyoumai Preservation Foundation for more information.

She received the name of Yachiyo INOUE at 96 years of age; before which she went by Haruko KATAYAMA; refer to the website of the Katayama Family Noh and Kyoumai Preservation Foundation for more information.
sen.cmt: Katayama→KATAYAMA 名字は大文字にと言う規定に従い、修正。
sen.e: She received the name of Yachiyo INOUE at 96 years of age; before which she went by Haruko KATAYAMA; refer to the website of the Katayama Family Noh and Kyoumai Preservation Foundation for more information.

sen.j: 後述のとおり、孫の片山博通の妻が四世井上八千代である。
sen.e: As is explained below, the wife of her grandson, Hiromichi KATAYAMA, was the 4th Yachiyo INOUE.
As is explained below, the wife of her grandson, Hiromichi KATAYAMA, was Yachiyo INOUE the 4th.
sen.cmt: 他と統一する為、the 4thを語尾に変更。
sen.e: As is explained below, the wife of her grandson, Hiromichi KATAYAMA, was Yachiyo INOUE the 4th.

sen.j: 北条秀司の戯曲「京舞」は、三世八千代と四世八千代を主人公としている。
sen.e: Hideji HOUJOU's play "Kyoumai" stars Yachiyo INOUE the 3rd and Yachiyo INOUE the 4th.
Hideji HOUJOU's play "Kyoumai" stars Yachiyo INOUE the 3rd and Yachiyo INOUE the 4th.
Hideji HOUJOU's play "Kyoumai" stars Yachiyo INOUE the 3rd and Yachiyo INOUE the 4th.

sen.j: 本名・片山 愛子（1905年5月14日 - 2004年3月19日）

sen.j: 後年隠居して初代井上愛子を名乗る。
sen.e: She retired in her old age and became Aiko INOUE the 1st.

sen.j: 夫は片山博通。

sen.j: 子に片山九郎右衛門 (9世)、片山慶次郎、杉浦元三郎（いずれも能楽能職掌観世流）。
sen.e: Children: Kurouemon KATAYAMA (the 9th), Keijirou KATAYAMA, and Motosaburou SUGIURA (all are Kanze School Noh actors)

sen.j: 代表作は「長刀八島」、「海士（あま）」、「鉄輪（かなわ）」、「信乃」ほか
